clips.what_happens_visually: Man in purple shirt gestures to his team, then looks directly into the camera with a knowing smile.
clips.meme_caption:
Me, introducing the intern
who actually ships code
clips.why_it_works: The visual of the knowing look combined with the punchline creates an instant shared understanding.

clips.what_happens_visually: Man exits orange sports car and extends hand to Richard, who looks confused.
clips.dialogue_hook: "Russ Hanneman. True pleasure to meet you."
clips.meme_caption:
VCs after your Series A
True pleasure to meet you
clips.why_it_works: The sports car and handshake are instantly recognizable signals of VC interest.

clips.what_happens_visually: Richard makes a series of guttural noises to imitate Russ.
clips.meme_caption:
Me, trying to explain
blockchain to my grandma
clips.why_it_works: The visual of the unintelligible noises captures the frustration of explaining complex tech.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ gestures dismissively at people walking by while standing next to his sports car.
clips.dialogue_hook: "They're billionaires and they drive fucking Priuses. Why?"
clips.meme_caption:
Why is Zuck wearing a hoodie?
He's a billionaire, Richard
clips.why_it_works: The juxtaposition of the sports car and the dismissal of Priuses creates a humorous contrast.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ points and says "Lemming" to random people walking by.
clips.meme_caption:
Calling out the herd
for using React
clips.why_it_works: The act of labeling people as 'lemmings' is instantly relatable to the tribalism in tech.

clips.what_happens_visually: Richard looks at Russ with a serious expression, then Russ smiles.
clips.dialogue_hook: "Well no one ever got laid putting money in the bank, am I right?"
clips.meme_caption:
Me, trying to justify
my crypto portfolio
clips.why_it_works: The facial expressions and the punchline perfectly capture the bravado and risk-taking in crypto.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ leans in and speaks directly to Richard.
clips.dialogue_hook: "Don't do what you should do. Do what you want."
clips.meme_caption:
Quitting your FAANG job
to build a startup
clips.why_it_works: The intensity of the delivery combined with the counter-intuitive advice resonates with the startup mentality.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ looks at a painting and asks, "Is it sperm?"
clips.meme_caption:
Me, trying to understand
NFT art
clips.why_it_works: The crude question about the abstract art is a relatable reaction to the perceived absurdity of NFTs.

clips.dialogue_hook: "You know you play your cards right you could be in the three comma club too. But probably not."
clips.meme_caption:
VCs be like
"We believe in you (but not really)"
clips.why_it_works: The backhanded compliment and intense stare capture the conditional nature of VC support.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ is driving away in his car.
clips.meme_caption:
Leaving a toxic job
for a 20% raise
clips.why_it_works: The simple visual of driving away combined with the explicit message creates a satisfying exit fantasy.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ stands in front of a pile of trash.
clips.dialogue_hook: "You know one of the things being in the three comma club has taught me Richard is it's not always about money."
clips.meme_caption:
Me, trying to justify
my startup's pivot
clips.news_hook: Is this the end of the AI boom?
clips.why_it_works: The visual of the trash pile combined with the statement about money creates a self-deprecating humor.

clips.what_happens_visually: Russ is driving away in his car.
clips.meme_caption:
When the VC says no
but you're already rich
clips.why_it_works: The visual of driving away combined with the explicit message creates a satisfying exit fantasy.
